title: For Sale:  Bushmaster Complete Lower 5.56/223 Very nice....Pre-Ban Maybe?
postcontent:
Low serial number L052xxxx could possibly be pre ban, I called Bushmaster last week to verify and the guy i talked to ran the number and said it was to low for him to pull up at this time due to system problems they are having so he said until then use this as info when selling it.

#s under 510000 are for sure pre ban
#s between 510000 and 620000 are mixed pre ban and post ban
#S over 62000 post ban

If this is the case this lower falls into mixed being low mixed and being sold as a complete rifle at the time with full rifle stock could very well be pre ban.
who cares? well some still do, there's a couple on gunbroker selling for 7 to 8 hundred. 

Im asking $425 or trade plus or minus cash for and only for the following:

title: For Sale:  RARE Bushmaster armpistol/survival gun AR
postcontent: This is a rare "Gwynn Firearms" Bushmaster pistol. Also known as the "arm pistol" or "survival gun". This gun was made by Gwynn Firearms, who ended up being Bushmaster. There were 3 variants of this weapon, this one is the 2nd variation. Most like this one the most because the safety is in the trigger guard, so you can actuate it and still have your finger on the trigger. This version also has the milled receiver.(early ones were stamped) One of the coolest features of this weapon is the fact that it uses AK style gas piston impingement system which is all the rage now. It uses the same bolt, trigger parts, mag release, and magazines as the AR. A unique feature of this weapon is the pistol grip-trigger assembly rotates side to side.(see pic) This weapon is also unique in the fact that you get a collector piece, and an ultra modern firearm in one piece. I am a machinist, so I machined an AR quad rail to fit, added a vertical grip, and a buttstock. It is an 11.5" barrel with permanently attached 4.5' suppressor, and is 25" overall in length. All updates are mounted as to not affect the original condition of this weapon. Simply remove a few bolts, and it is back to original collector condition. Thanks for looking

This is a very clean firearm with only modest wear of the bluing around the muzzle and the front rub points of the receiver from the holster.

There are NO import markings on this firearm... and it was almost certainly a bring back. It is Nazi issue with all of the pertinent proofs and the serial numbers from what I can tell are all matching as well. There are no evident dings or scratches. I would put the condition of this firearm at good to very good.

Email me for a TON of very detailed pictures if you are interested.

I have an original issue german black leather holster for this as well, which will be extra.

Thanks for looking

title: For Sale:  Ruger 10/22 Tactical with Marauder G36 Stock + Extras (never fired!)
postcontent:
Up for sale is a Ruger 10/22 that has been modified just a bit. Some of the modifications include:

Power Customs Competition Hammer
* originally equipped hammer is included
Skeletonized charging handle
* originally equipped charging handle is included
Marauder G36 Stock Kit (with folding butt-stock)
* originally equipped stock is included
UTG Picatinny rails on the sides

Extras include:
3 Ruger DX-25 Magazines
1 25 round ProMag Magazine
1 Ruger 10 round Magazine
500 rounds of .22LR

Yes this gun is brand new. Just a light greasing/oiling and stored. Originally was waiting for a nice day to shoot it; now with the nice days finally here I just don't have the enthusiasm to get the Ruger out and use it. I started this project to make a fun toy to go shooting with that had the tactical feel of a more expensive rifle. This certainly reached that pinnacle but I've grown bored of it and wish to move onto a different project. I had intended to put a bull barrel on the gun but since storing it interest has tapered off into a different direction.

I know some of you may be thinking that $500 is a bit steep for a Ruger 10/22. This is no plain-jane Ruger 10/22. Lets add up all the modifications + extras that are included with this sale..

Ruger 10/22 - $300~ with taxes, misc. fees included (Big5 Sporting Goods)
Marauder G36 Stock - 153.99 with shipping (CheaperthenDirt.com)
Power Custom Hammer - $45.94 with shipping (Brownells.com)
Ruger BX-25 (X3) - $93.25 with shipping (Brownells.com)
500 rounds of .22LR - $25 (Local)
For a grand total of: $618.18
Now I'm selling the gun for $500.00

That's a difference of $118.18! That's $120 dollars I've spent that has been put back into your pocket. I would say that's a great deal!

EDIT: The MAGPUL AFG and Red-Dot sight are not included with the sale

title: For Sale:  Mosin Nagant 91/30 Custom Sniper Rifle + 400 rounds
postcontent:
Up for sale is a Mosin Nagant that has been completely and thoroughly sporterized. I know this auction may offend some of the purists out there but this particular rifle has had no historical connection that has in any way, shape, or form made it more rare then the millions of other Mosin Nagant 91/30s out there. So I feel no shame in having sporterized this particular rifle. The gun has had less then 100 rounds through it and has performed flawlessly. Russian engineering at it's best.

Modifications include:
Monte Carlo stock (barrel has been free-floated)
The barrel was cut to 20" and recrown at 11degrees.
Finnish ball-roller M38 trigger was installed
Sear Spacer
Trigger Return Spring
Custom turn-down bolt-handle (sniper style)
Wolff Hi-Pressure Spring
S&K Scope Mount (utilizes original mount)
AIMPOINT Long-Eye Relief Scope (cheap)
Bolt has been polished for a smoother action

Extras include:
.50 cal can full of 54R (approx. 400+ rounds)

The gun has been partially duracoated a semi-gloss/matte black. The reason I say partially is because I had originally not intended to duracoat the Mosin but found that after painting another project I had some left over. Mid-way through the process I ran out of duracoat. There are two areas that are partially painted and the rest has only had one layer applied. You can easily strip the gun down and duracoat the remainder with a $30 dollar Mix-n-Spray kit available from Brownells. Shouldn't affect the durability of the duracoat at all.

title: For Sale/Trade:  2002 Dodge Caravan
postcontent:
2002 Dodge Caravan with 120,650 miles 4 door. Blueish gray with gray interior.

Last year the trans went out and I had it rebuilt by a local shop and it worked great for awhile. It started acting up so I took it back and the shop had closed down (just my luck). Had another shop tell me it was the TCM (trans control module) so I replaced it ($350) with a new one. Shifts fine now but the spedo started jumping around when stopped so I replaced the speed sensors and that didn't fix it. It drives  and shifts fine but when stopped the speedo jumps between 0-20mph. I am sick of working on it so it has to go.

Good
New trans
New tcm
New radiator
Newer tires
Clean van

IBad
The plastic pully for the drivers window broke and needs to be replaced
Needs brakes but the rotors are one brake job old and the pads and shoes have lifetime warranty from autozone.
Paint on the hood is bubbling but not pealing.

It's a good van but I'm tired of it and its a 3td vehicle so I want to let it go.  firm on price sense it has over 2k in work in the past year. 

Will trade for firearms

title: For Sale:  Concealed Carry Course June 2nd
location: MAYSVILLE - A short ride from anywhere!, Jacksonville, North Carolina
postcontent:
Summer Special: Just $90 for the most comprehensive CCH class in North Carolina.  Reserve your seat today!

Upon successful completion of this course, you will be able to apply for a Concealed Handgun Permit through your county Sheriff's office. 

N.C. Law requires every citizen to attend a State mandated EIGHT (8) hour course prior to filing application for a Concealed Carry Handgun (CCH) Permit (8 hours PLUS range time).  This course meets the requirements established by the North Carolina Department of Criminal Justice Training and Standards Division. This is by far the MOST COMPREHENSIVE COURSE in all of Eastern North Carolina, yet it's the same length as all the rest.

(Note: If someone claiming to be a certified CCH Instructor offers you a CCH Class/Course that is LESS THAN 8 HOURS PLUS RANGE TIME, you should report them to the N.C. D.O.J. Training and Standards Division by calling REDACTED.  If you attend such a course and it’s discovered by the state, you can face criminal charges along with the instructor.)

We make the most of your time both in the classroom and on the range.  We understand most people in Onslow County already know handgun fundamentals; therefore, we focus on teaching you want most people don't know; the LAW.  

Most instructors teach to the minimum standards, and many available CCH courses provide only the bare minimum training required by law.  This would cause students leaves the class without having a real-world understanding of the legal issues.

At Patriot Training and Consulting, we're committed to ensuring every student leaves our courses knowing the law as it pertains to concealed carry, Castle Doctrine, and the use of deadly force.  

This course is for experienced shooters who are proficient with handguns.
If you would like to obtain your Concealed Carry Handgun permit, but don't yet have the training and proficiency, you can take one of our other handgun courses or classes.

During this course, students must pass both a practical shooting test and a written test on the North Carolina Concealed Carry and Use of Deadly Force laws.

Course Fee: $100.00 

To register for a course and to see additional training options, visit our website at www.PatriotTAC.com and Like us on Facebook.

Summer Special: Just $90. 

Upon successful completion of this course, you will be able to apply for a Concealed Handgun Permit through your county Sheriff's office. 

N.C. Law requires every citizen to attend a State mandated EIGHT (8) hour course prior to filing application for a Concealed Carry Handgun (CCH) Permit (8 hours PLUS range time).  This course meets the requirements established by the North Carolina Department of Criminal Justice Training and Standards Division. This is by far the MOST COMPREHENSIVE COURSE in all of Eastern North Carolina.

(Note: If someone claiming to be a certified CCH Instructor offers you a CCH Class/Course that is LESS THAN I HOURS PLUS RANGE TIME, you should report them to the N.C. D.O.J. Training and Standards Division by calling REDACTED).  If you attend such a course and it’s discovered by the state, you can face criminal charges along with the instructor.)

We make the most of your time both in the classroom and on the range.  We understand most people in Onslow County already know handgun fundamentals; therefore, we focus on teaching you want most people don't know; the LAW.  

Most instructors teach to the minimum standards, and many available CCH courses provide only the bare minimum training required by law.  This would cause students leaves the class without having a real-world understanding of the legal issues.

At Patriot Training and Consulting, we're committed to ensuring every student leaves our courses knowing the law as it pertains to concealed carry, Castle Doctrine, and the use of deadly force.  

This course is for experienced shooters who are proficient with handguns.

During this course, students must pass both a practical shooting test and a written test on the North Carolina Concealed Carry and Use of Deadly Force laws.

title: For Sale:  2.5x30B Scope Kit for Mauser K98 Style Rifles & Carbines
postcontent:
Includes:
- 2.5x30MM WIDE ANGLE SCOUT SCOPE -
- NEW MAUSER 98K LOW POFILE SCOPE MOUNT –
- LOW PROFILE SCOPE RINGS –

- $84.00 Includes Free Shipping to Any US Address –

We accept payment by PayPal or USPS Money Order. Please send email for ordering instructions.

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =
NO FIREARMS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS SALE!
= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =

For most large ring Mauser style rifles and carbines based on the German 98K design with a flip-up rear sight hinged in the front and including the Turkish M24/47, Czech VZ 24, German Model GEW 98, KAR 98, Yugo M48, Persian (Iran) copies of the Czech M24, Argentine 1909, Spanish 1943, and others based on the original 1898 Mauser design.

The Mauser 8x57 cartridge is in the same class as the American 30-06 and is popular for hunting big game in the United States. This 2.5X scope gives you an excellent field of view at close range while still providing enough magnification to see your target out to 150 yards or more. Take advantage of the inherent accuracy of your Mauser military carbine or rifle by adding this scout scope and increasing your rifle’s effective hunting range.
= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =

SCOPE SPECIFICATIONS:
+ Magnification: 2.5X Wide Angle
+ Objective Lens: 30mm
+ Duplex Reticle
+ Eye Relief – 10 to 12 inches
+ One Inch ScopeTube
+  Weight: 8.5 Ounces
+  Length: 8.75 inches
+  Matte Black Finish
+  Windage/Elevation: 1 Click = 1/2" @100 Yards
+  Multi-Coated Lenses
+  Bright Optics
+  Sharp Focusing
+  Eye Piece Focus Lock Ring
+  Nitrogen Filled - Fog and Water Proof
+  Shock Proof – Heavy Duty Recoil Design
+  Protective Lens Caps Included
+ New in Box with Manufacturer’s Limited Lifetime Replacement Warranty *

MOUNT SPECIFICATIONS:
This new scout scope mount has been designed with CROSS BOLT mounting and a nut to insure a solid and rigid installation. We also include extra-low rings to provide low visual alignment mounting of the 2.5x30mm scout scope.

+ For most Mauser 98K caliber 7.9mm (8x57) Rifles with original Mil-Spec rear sights
+ No modifications to rifle required
+ Easy Installation - "No Gunsmithing" Mount Replaces Rear Sight – Bolts Directly into Rear Sight Base
+ Hardened Matte Black Aluminum Mount with Multiple Picatinny Rail Slots - accepts Weaver Style Rings
+ One Piece High Tensile Strength Alloy Steel Mounting Bolt with Locking Nut – other scope mounts are made of soft aluminum and use two short screws which can strip the aluminum mount threads or break from the heavy recoil of this rifle.**
+ Allen wrenches and adjusting screws included.
+ Use with Extended Eye Relief (EER) Scopes, Hologram and Red Dot Sights with long or unlimited eye relief. 
+ Standard short eye relief scopes will not work with this mount.
+ Installation Instructions Included
+ Easily Restore Rifle to Original Configuration by Removing the Scope Mount and Reinstalling the Rear Sight
+ New Mount with Manufacturer’s One Year Replacement Warranty
+ NOTE: Due to the age, styles and manufacturing tolerances of the many models of Mauser rifles, some minor fitting of this mount may be required.

Some vendors are selling mounts that use two short bolts threaded into the sides of the mount through the “ears” of the rear sight base.  With extended shooting these bolts strip out the threads in the aluminum scope mount and the mount becomes loose.  Our mount has been threaded completely through and is fitted with a full length threaded cross bolt and retaining nut that securely attaches the scope mount to the rear sight base. This mount will not shoot loose.

RINGS SPECIFICATIONS:
+ Strong Lightweight Aluminum
+ Non-Slip Mounting
+ Matte Black Finish
+ Low Profile
+ One Inch Diameter
+ New in Box
+ Fits Weaver Style Bases or Picatinny Rail
+ Note: Rings Style May Vary Slightly from those shown in Photos
+ New Scope Rings with Manufacturer’s One Year Replacement Warranty
= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = 
PLEASE READ TERMS OF WARRANTIES BEFORE ORDERING!!
= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = 

REPLACEMENT WARRANTIES:

The individual components of this SCOPE KIT are warranted by their respective manufacturers to be free of defects by reasons of workmanship and/or defective materials. The warranties do not cover damage caused by improper installation, abuse or accidents and no other warranties are offered or implied.  If one or more of the components fails to function properly and/or is found to be otherwise defective it/they will be repaired or replaced as follows:

* Scope: Buyer must return the scope, shipping prepaid, to the manufacturer for inspection and testing.  If found to be defective, the manufacturer will repair or replace the scope and return it directly to the purchaser.

* Mount and Rings: Buyer must return the mount and/or rings to the seller for inspection and testing. If found to be defective, the seller will replace the mount and/or rings and return them directly to the purchaser.

* No other warranties are offered or implied and cash refunds are not offered by the seller.

PAYMENT TERMS:
+ Payment by PayPal or USPS in U.S. dollars.
+ Colorado buyers please add 4.9% ($4.12) sales tax.

SHIPPING: 
+ Orders are shipped by USPS Domestic Priority Mail within three business days after receipt of payment to the address specified in your PayPal payment.
+ Please insure that your address and telephone number are correct.
+ We print shipping labels, tracking data and postage on the US Post Office web site.
+ If you receive First Class and Priority Mail at a Post Office Box, do not use a street address that is not in the Post Office data base.
+ Address must be certified by PayPal. If NOT certified, we will ship to the address specified by PayPal, but will not be responsible for shipping to the wrong address.

If unsatisfied with our products or service, please notify us immediately so that we can resolve any issues you may have.

Thank you for purchasing our scope kits.

Monument, CO USA

I have a 1990 Bayliner Capri 17' foot Bowrider open bow pleasure boat, I am asking $4,000 obo, It has an excellent running ( Force 50 ) 50Hp U.S. Marine Power long shaft outboard motor, That was freshly rebuilt two years ago and has had a new propeller installed on it just a couple months ago, It had a new Deep cycle marine battery installed in it last year and has been on the water once before storing it for the winter...

The Boat also comes with an Escort boat trailer that has Bearing Buddy hubs installed on it that has the centered zirk grease fittings to seal and lub the wheel bearings, It also had the tailights updated to longer lasting waterproof sealed LED tailights a couple years ago, I had it all appraised last fall to add it on my home-owners insurance policy, It appraised for around $6,500 dollars all together for the boat trailer & outboard motor, This it what it all appraised for ( the Boat appraised for $3,000 dollars by itself, the 50hp Outboard motor & controls appraised for $2,500 dollars, & the Escort Trailer appaised for $1,000 dollars ), And that is W/O any boating accessories included...

I have Ohio titles in hand for both the Boat and the Outboard motor, As well as an Ohio DMV registration for the trailer, The boat has a couple years still left on the Boats Registration Sticker that is on the side of the boat, Which is good clear up to March 2013 two seasons from now...

I would prefer to sell it outright, But would be willing to consider trade offers for a really good running "2004" or newer 500cc or bigger Utility style 4x4 ATV four wheeler with a snow plow and a trailerbif possible to haul it, Or maybe a nice "2000" or newer Side by Side 4wd UTV from makers like ( Polaris , Honda , John Deere , Kawasaki , Can Am , Suzuki , Cub Cadet ) and so on...

I would also be willing to consider trading for a good running Compact style tractor with front end loader or backhoe attachment on it, Something like a ( Kubota, Yanmar, John Deere, Case, Ford, Cub Cadet ) and so on, As long as it is a good running piece of Equipment that does not have any major issues...

I would also prefer trades to have some kind of a trailer with it, So that it can be hauled around to where ever I would need to take it if possible... 

So just email me if you have any questions or trade offers you want me to consider, The worst I can say is no thank you for your offer, You can also contact me at ( 7 four 0 ) five 4 three - 3 eight 5 two, And ask for Ken or Kenneth...
